content.title: Subclavian Artery Anatomy
content.description: Major artery supplying the upper extremity, arising from aortic arch (left) or brachiocephalic trunk (right), with important branches including vertebral artery.

origin.left: Direct from aortic arch (between left CCA and vertebral)

divisions.third_part: Lateral to anterior scalene to lateral border of first rib

relations.anterior_scalene: Key landmark, divides subclavian into parts
relations.subclavian_vein: Anterior to artery, separated by scalene

content.continuation: Becomes axillary artery at lateral border of first rib
content.statement: Subclavian Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Upper-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Subclavian Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Subclavian Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Subclavian Artery Anatomy.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Subclavian Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
